unnormalised: **Solar Rooftop Subsidies Boost Adoption in Rajasthan**
normalised: **Solar Rooftop Subsidies Boost Adoption in Rajasthan**

unnormalised: Jaipur, Rajasthan – The Rajasthan Renewable Energy Corporation (RREC) has announced increased subsidies for rooftop solar installations, effective immediately. The move is aimed at accelerating the state's ambitious renewable energy goals and reducing dependence on conventional power sources, especially during peak summer months.
normalised: Jaipur, Rajasthan – The R R E C has announced increased subsidies for rooftop solar installations, effective immediately. The move is aimed at accelerating the state's ambitious renewable energy goals and reducing dependence on conventional power sources, especially during peak summer months.

unnormalised: Under the revised scheme, residential consumers installing solar panels on rooftops can now avail subsidies of up to 40% for systems up to 3 kW. For installations between 3 kW and 10 kW, a 20% subsidy will be applicable. Dr. Meena Sharma, Director of RREC, stated that this enhancement will make solar power more accessible to middle-class families.
normalised: Under the revised scheme, residential consumers installing solar panels on rooftops can now avail subsidies of up to forty percent for systems up to three kilowatt. For installations between three kilowatt and ten kilowatt, a twenty percent subsidy will be applicable. Doctor Meena Sharma, Director of R R E C, stated that this enhancement will make solar power more accessible to middle-class families.

unnormalised: “We are seeing growing interest from homeowners in cities like Jodhpur and Udaipur," Dr. Sharma added. The subsidy covers the cost of panels, inverters, and installation charges, effectively reducing the financial burden on consumers. Early adopters report annual savings of Rs. 20,000 on electricity bills for a 5 kW system installed on approximately 500 sq ft of rooftop space. This initiative aims to power homes sustainably and contribute towards a greener future for Rajasthan, aligning with national initiatives like the PM-KUSUM scheme. The application process is streamlined through the RREC website.
normalised: “We are seeing growing interest from homeowners in cities like Jodhpur and Udaipur," Doctor Sharma added. The subsidy covers the cost of panels, inverters, and installation charges, effectively reducing the financial burden on consumers. Early adopters report annual savings of rupee twenty thousand on electricity bills for a five kilowatt system installed on approximately five hundred square feet of rooftop space. This initiative aims to power homes sustainably and contribute towards a greener future for Rajasthan, aligning with national initiatives like the P M K U S U M scheme. The application process is streamlined through the R R E C website.
